subject: Re: [junit] Can you use junit to monitor stock?
msgSnippet: ... I think a good continuation of the story would be to tell your friend that you have used TestNG for quite a similar purpose, but it made you won 1mil USD
messageBody:
On 29 Mar 2007 09:04:09 -0700, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
> On 29 Mar 2007 07:57:46 -0700, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> > Hi Cheng,
> >
> > On 29 Mar 2007 05:22:20 -0700, Cheng <wjcheng@...> wrote:
> > > Can you use junit to monitor stock? Someone told me that he used
> > > Junit to monitor a stock called BVSN and that alert him on the price
> > > up. Is it possible? Or is it just a joke? Any comment are
> > > appreciated, and if you know how to technically, I would like to hear.
> >
> > When you write a JUnit test, you have the full power of Java in your
> > hands. Thus, it is possible to do pretty much anything through a JUnit
> > test that you can do in Java--including polling a stock web service to
> > check that the stock price hasn't gone up. Whether it makes sense to
> > do such a thing using JUnit, that's another question.
>
> In other words, I'm pretty sure your friend was pulling a prank on you.
>
> You should totally get back at him. Keep us posted :-)
>

I think a good continuation of the story would be to tell your friend
that you have used TestNG for quite a similar purpose, but it made you
won 1mil USD :-).

./alex
--
.w( the_mindstorm )p.
TestNG co-founder
EclipseTestNG Creator

> --
> Cédric
>
